newsitem.title: USA: CSCE cocoa surges late on spec, trade buying.
newsitem.headline: CSCE cocoa surges late on spec, trade buying.

text.p: CSCE cocoa prices rocketed higher late in the session, surging more than $50 per tonne amid heavy speculative and industry buying, market sources said.
Nearby March futures leapt to a peak of $1,313, up $53 from the previous close, as traders scrambled to cover short positions racked up during the last week.
"It's mostly short-covering," said one. "Stops were hit at $1,290 (basis March) and again above $1,310."
Today's rally comes after a week in which cocoa futures lost more than five percent of their value, sliding to new life-of-contract lows in successive sessions.
Dealers said the run-up was mainly a correction from a sharply oversold condition, but they noted some new buying once key resistance levels were cleared.
At 1346 EST, March cocoa was $47 higher, at $1,307, just off its earlier top of $1,313. Second-position May was also up $47, to $1,342.
((-- W Pollack, New York Commodities Desk +1 212 859 1640))
